subject: p15114531
History: -year-old woman with shortness of breath, productive cough, rhonchorous, and recent hospitalization. Evaluate for pneumonia.
Findings: The right PICC has been removed in the interim. The lungs are well-expanded and clear. No focal consolidation, effusion, edema, or pneumothorax. The heart size is normal. The mediastinum is not widened. Surgical clips project over the left upper quadrant, unchanged. Anterior spinal fixation in the lower cervical spine is partially imaged. Multilevel degenerative changes in the thoracic spine are mild. Rightward curvature of the thoracic spine could be positional though was also present on .
